foul verb
(SPORT)
[ I or T ] to do something against the rules of a sport
[ I or T ] in baseball, to hit a ball outside the playing area

foul verb
(MAKE DIRTY)
[ T ] formal to spoil or damage something by making it dirty: The oil spill fouled the river and destroyed habitats.
